The web is mobile

29 Aug 2022 by Josh

The following pie chart really shows how the smartphone era has changed the web. I have this in my striking graphs category - but it is really only striking to those not born this century (and hence old enough to remember a smartphone era). The figures are browsers more than about 1% share sampled from this caniuse.com page (on 2022-08-29). The percentages on the piechart are the percentages of overall browser useage (which is how Chrome for Android version 104 is only 42.87% when on this piechart it is clearly half the piechart).

Nigh on 60% is mobile browsers. And while the iPhone, which got touchscreen phones fashionable rather than the geeky/business oriented HTC Universal - it was the successors to the rather geeky HTC Dream that became the devices running Android and the Chrome browser that make up most of the market. They do not of course come with keyboards - like that first commercial Android phone did.
